00078 #else

00101

00118     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00119     ! bianchi2_sky_init
00120     !
00140 
00141     function bianchi2_sky_init(omega_matter_in, omega_lambda_in, h, zE_in, wH, rhand, &
00142          nside) result(b)
00143 
00144       use bianchi2_globaldata_mod
00145       use pix_tools, only: pix2ang_ring, nside2npix, in_ring 
00146 
00147       real(s2_dp), intent(in) :: omega_matter_in, omega_lambda_in, h, zE_in, wH
00148       logical, intent(in) :: rhand
00149       integer, intent(in) :: nside
00150       type(bianchi2_sky) :: b
00151 
00152       real(s2_dp) :: thetaOB, phiOB     ! Observing angles.
00153       real(s2_dp) :: theta0, phi0       ! Barrow's angle convention. 
00154   
00155       integer :: nt_use
00156       real(s2_dp) :: tstop_use
00157       real(s2_dp) :: tau_needed
00158       real(s2_dp) :: fact, U10_req, Phi1
00159       real(s2_dp) :: R_final, RH_final, cos_bit_final, sin_bit_final, other_bit
00160       real(s2_dp) :: Lambda, final_dens, t0
00161 
00162       integer :: npix, ipix, fail
00163       real(s2_dp), allocatable :: map(:)
00164       real(s2_sp) :: handedness_sign = +1d0
00165 
00166       real(s2_dp), parameter :: PHI_CENTRE = 0.0d0  ! Extract extire rings.
00167       real(s2_dp), parameter :: PHI_DIFF = PI
00168       integer :: iring, nring, max_pix_per_ring, npixring
00169       integer, allocatable :: ipixring(:)
00170 
00171       ! Check object not already initialised.
00172       if(b%init) then
00173         call bianchi2_error(BIANCHI2_ERROR_INIT, 'bianchi2_sky_init')
00174         return
00175       end if
00176 
00177       ! Initialise parameters passed as arguments.
00178       b%omega_matter = omega_matter_in
00179       b%omega_lambda = omega_lambda_in
00180       b%h = h
00181       b%zE = zE_in
00182       b%wH = wH
00183       b%rhand = rhand
00184 
00185       ! Initialise healpix map settings.
00186       npix = nside2npix(nside)
00187       allocate(map(0:npix-1), stat=fail)
00188       map = 0d0
00189       if(fail /= 0) then
00190          call bianchi2_error(BIANCHI2_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_FAIL, &
00191            'bianchi2_sky_init')
00192       end if
00193 
00194       ! Set handedness sign.
00195       if(b%rhand) then
00196          handedness_sign = 1d0
00197       else
00198          handedness_sign = -1d0
00199       end if
00200 
00201 !       ! Allocate global data.
00202 !       allocate(b2gd_treal(1:b2gd_ntmax), stat=fail)
00203 !       allocate(b2gd_xreal(1:b2gd_ntmax), stat=fail)
00204 !       allocate(b2gd_tarr(1:b2gd_ntmax), stat=fail)
00205 !       allocate(b2gd_xarr(1:b2gd_nvars, 1:b2gd_ntmax), stat=fail)
00206 !       if(fail /= 0) then
00207 !          call bianchi2_error(BIANCHI2_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_FAIL, &
00208 !            'bianchi2_sky_init')
00209 !       end if
00210 
00211       ! Set global data.
00212       b2gd_Bianchi_h = b%h
00213       b2gd_Omega_matter = b%omega_matter
00214       b2gd_Omega_Lambda = b%omega_lambda
00215       b2gd_ze = b%zE
00216       b2gd_alpha = sqrt(b%h)
00217       b2gd_RH_start = sqrt(-b2gd_alpha**2/(b%omega_matter+b%omega_lambda-1d0))
00218 
00219       ! Initialise other variables.
00220       nt_use = 3
00221       b2gd_alpha = sqrt(b%h)
00222       b2gd_RH_start = sqrt(-b2gd_alpha**2/(b%omega_matter+b%omega_lambda-1d0))
00223       call get_tau(tau_needed)
00224       tstop_use=-tau_needed
00225       Lambda = 3*b2gd_RH_start**2*b%omega_lambda
00226 
00227       ! Set ring parameter values.
00228       nring = 4*nside - 1
00229       max_pix_per_ring = 4*nside
00230 
00231       ! Allocate space for ring pixel indices.
00232       allocate(ipixring(0:max_pix_per_ring-1), stat=fail)
00233       if(fail /= 0) then
00234          call bianchi2_error(BIANCHI2_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_FAIL, &
00235            'bianchi2_sky_init')
00236       end if
00237       ipixring = 0
00238 
00239       ! Compute map value for each pixel in each ring.
00240       ! Do ring at a time since A and B functions of theta so once need
00241       ! to compute once for each ring.
00242       do iring = 1, nring    ! Checked this and ring is indeed indexed from 1.
00243 
00244 !          if(mod(iring,nring/4) == 0) then
00245 !             write(*,'(a,f5.1,a)') ' Percent complete: ', &
00246 !                  iring/real(nring,s2_sp)*100e0, '%'
00247 !          end if
00248 
00249          ! Get ring_pix in order to determine theta of ring.
00250          call in_ring(nside, iring, PHI_CENTRE, PHI_DIFF, ipixring, &
00251               & npixring, nest=0) ! Ring scheme!!!!!!!!!
00252 
00253          ! Calculate thetaOB for current ring.
00254          call pix2ang_ring(nside, ipixring(0), thetaOB, phiOB)
00255 
00256          ! Set photon theta angle from observation angle.
00257          theta0 = PI - thetaOB
00258 
00259          ! Set global data.
00260          ! (Compute theta_0 for ANL's convention.)
00261          b2gd_theta_0 = theta0 - pi/2d0
00262 
00263          ! Compute terms for constant theta.
00264          call get_results(tstop_use,R_final,RH_final,cos_bit_final,sin_bit_final)
00265          fact = sqrt(9.D0*b2gd_alpha**2+1.D0)*sqrt(1.D0+b2gd_alpha**2)* &
00266                 sqrt(1.D0-b%omega_matter-b%omega_lambda)**3.D0/b2gd_alpha**3 &
00267                 /b%omega_matter/6.D0
00268          U10_req = b%wH/fact
00269 
00270          ! Compute map valus for all pixels in current ring.
00271          do ipix = 0,npixring-1
00272 
00273             ! Calculate thetaOB for current ring.
00274             call pix2ang_ring(nside, ipixring(ipix), thetaOB, phiOB)
00275 
00276             ! Set photon phi angle from observation angle.
00277             phi0 = phiOB - PI
00278 
00279             ! Account for handedness 
00280             ! (also component outside loop to account for handedness).
00281             phi0 = phi0 * handedness_sign
00282 
00283             !  Compute phi_0 for ANL's convention.
00284             b2gd_phi_0 = phi0 + 3d0/4d0*pi
00285 
00286             ! Get first contribution.
00287             Phi1 = U10_req/R_final*(sin_bit_final*sin(b2gd_phi_0)+cos_bit_final*cos(b2gd_phi_0))
00288             map(ipixring(ipix)) = -Phi1/(1+b2gd_ze)*2d0   ! JDM: Need factor 2 to make agree
00289 
00290             ! Now get end contribution.
00291             final_dens = (3d0*RH_final**2-Lambda*R_final**2-3d0*b2gd_alpha**2)/(R_final**2)
00292             t0 = 3.D0/final_dens/R_final**5*cos((b2gd_phi_0*b2gd_alpha-b2gd_alpha*tstop_use- &
00293                 dlog(cos(pi/4.D0+b2gd_theta_0/2.D0)**2.D0+exp(-2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)- &
00294                 exp(-2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)*cos(pi/4.D0+b2gd_theta_0/2.D0)**2.D0))/b2gd_alpha)* &
00295                 exp(b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)*cos(b2gd_theta_0)/(-1.D0-sin(b2gd_theta_0)+ &
00296                 exp(2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)*sin(b2gd_theta_0)-exp(2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use))*b2gd_alpha+ &
00297                 1.D0/final_dens/R_final**5*sin((b2gd_phi_0*b2gd_alpha-b2gd_alpha*tstop_use- &
00298                 dlog(cos(pi/4.D0+b2gd_theta_0/2.D0)**2.D0+exp(-2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)- & 
00299                 exp(-2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)*cos(pi/4.D0+b2gd_theta_0/2.D0)**2.D0))/b2gd_alpha)* &
00300                 exp(b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)*cos(b2gd_theta_0)/(-1.D0-sin(b2gd_theta_0)+ &
00301                 exp(2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)*sin(b2gd_theta_0)-exp(2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use))
00302             other_bit = U10_req*t0
00303 
00304             map(ipixring(ipix)) = map(ipixring(ipix)) - other_bit/(1+b2gd_ze)*2d0           
00305             
00306          end do
00307 
00308       end do
00309 
00310 !       write(*,'(a)') ' Percent complete: 100.0%'
00311 
00312       ! Account for handedness.
00313       map = handedness_sign * map
00314 
00315       ! Convert Delta_T/T map computed to Delta_T map.
00316       map = BIANCHI2_CMB_T * map
00317 
00318       ! Initialise sky object with map.
00319       b%sky = s2_sky_init(real(map,s2_sp), nside, S2_SKY_RING)
00320 
00321       ! Set initialised status.
00322       b%init = .true.
00323 
00324 !       ! Free global data.
00325 !       deallocate(b2gd_treal)
00326 !       deallocate(b2gd_xreal)
00327 !       deallocate(b2gd_tarr)
00328 !       deallocate(b2gd_xarr)
00329 
00330       ! Free memory.
00331       deallocate(map)
00332       deallocate(ipixring)
00333 
00334     end function bianchi2_sky_init
00335 
00336 
00337 
00338     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00339     ! bianchi2_sky_init_alm
00340     !
00341     !! Initialise bianchi2 object by performing a bianchi2 simulation that
00342     !! incorporates a cosmological constant.
00343     !!
00344     !! Variables:
00345     !!  - omega_matter_in: Input omega_matter parameter (see bianchi2 data
00346     !!    type for explanation).
00347     !!  - omega_lambda_in: Input omega_lambda parameter (see bianchi2 data
00348     !!    type for explanation).
00349     !!  - h: Input h parameter (see bianchi2 data type for explanation).
00350     !!  - zE_in: Input zE parameter (see bianchi2 data type for explanation).
00351     !!  - wH: Input wH parameter (see bianchi2 data type for explanation).
00352     !!  - rhand: Logical to specify handedness of map.
00353     !!  - nside: Nside of Healpix map to generate.
00354     !!  - lmax: Maximum harmonic l to consider.
00355     !!  - Nuse : Number of terms in use in the integrations IA and IB.
00356     !!  - alpha: Alpha Euler angle of the rotation.
00357     !!  - beta: Beta Euler angle of the rotation.
00358     !!  - gamma: Gamma Euler angle of the rotation.
00359     !!  
00360     !
00361     !! @author T. Josset
00362     !! @version 0.1 April 2012
00363     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00364 
00365     function bianchi2_sky_init_alm(omega_matter_in, omega_lambda_in, h, zE_in, wH, rhand, &
00366          nside, lmax, Nuse, alpha, beta, gamma) result(b)
00367 
00368       use bianchi2_globaldata_mod
00369       use s2_dl_mod, only : s2_dl_beta_operator
00370 
00371       real(s2_dp), intent(in) :: omega_matter_in, omega_lambda_in, h, zE_in, wH
00372       logical, intent(in) :: rhand
00373       integer, intent(in) :: nside, lmax, Nuse
00374       type(bianchi2_sky) :: b
00375   
00376       real(s2_dp) :: tstop_use
00377       real(s2_dp) :: tau_needed
00378       real(s2_dp) :: fact, U10_req
00379       real(s2_dp) :: R_final, RH_final, cos_bit_final, sin_bit_final
00380       real(s2_dp) :: Lambda, final_dens
00381 
00382       integer :: npix, ipix, fail
00383 
00384       ! Parameters for computing alm
00385       complex(s2_spc), allocatable :: alm(:,:)
00386       real(s2_dp) :: handedness_sign = +1d0, lsign = 1d0
00387       integer :: l, itheta
00388       real(s2_dp), allocatable :: A_grid(:), B_grid(:)  
00389       real(s2_dp) :: theta_inc
00390       real(s2_dp) :: C_sin, C_cos
00391       real(s2_dp) :: IA, IB
00392       
00393       ! Parameters for the rotation
00394       real(s2_sp), intent(in), optional :: alpha, beta, gamma
00395       real(s2_sp), parameter :: ZERO_TOL = 1d-4
00396       real(s2_dp), pointer :: dl(:,:) => null()
00397       integer :: m
00398       complex(s2_spc), allocatable :: alm_rotate(:,:)
00399       complex(s2_dpc) :: Dm_p1, Dm_m1
00400       complex(s2_dpc) :: icmpx
00401 
00402       ! Set icmpx=sqrt(-1)
00403       icmpx = cmplx(0d0,1d0)
00404 
00405       ! Check object not already initialised.
00406       if(b%init) then
00407         call bianchi2_error(BIANCHI2_ERROR_INIT, 'bianchi2_sky_init')
00408         return
00409       end if
00410 
00411       ! Initialise parameters passed as arguments.
00412       b%omega_matter = omega_matter_in
00413       b%omega_lambda = omega_lambda_in
00414       b%h = h
00415       b%zE = zE_in
00416       b%wH = wH
00417       b%rhand = rhand
00418 
00419       ! Initialise healpix alm settings.
00420       allocate(alm(0:lmax,0:1), stat=fail)
00421       alm = cmplx(0d0, 0d0)
00422       if(fail /= 0) then
00423         call bianchi2_error(BIANCHI2_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_FAIL, &
00424           'bianchi2_sky_init_alm')
00425       end if
00426 
00427 
00428       ! Set handedness sign.
00429       if(b%rhand) then
00430          handedness_sign = 1d0
00431       else
00432          handedness_sign = -1d0
00433       end if
00434 
00435       ! Set global data.
00436       b2gd_Bianchi_h = b%h
00437       b2gd_Omega_matter = b%omega_matter
00438       b2gd_Omega_Lambda = b%omega_lambda
00439       b2gd_ze = b%zE
00440       b2gd_alpha = sqrt(b%h)
00441       b2gd_RH_start = sqrt(-b2gd_alpha**2/(b%omega_matter+b%omega_lambda-1d0))
00442 
00443       ! Initialise other variables.
00444       b2gd_alpha = sqrt(b%h)
00445       b2gd_RH_start = sqrt(-b2gd_alpha**2/(b%omega_matter+b%omega_lambda-1d0))
00446       call get_tau(tau_needed)
00447       tstop_use=-tau_needed    
00448 
00449 
00450 
00451       ! Calculate A(theta) and B(theta) terms
00452       allocate(A_grid(0:Nuse-1), stat=fail)
00453       allocate(B_grid(0:Nuse-1), stat=fail)
00454 
00455       if(fail /= 0) then
00456          call bianchi2_error(BIANCHI2_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_FAIL, &
00457             'bianchi2_sky_init_alm')
00458       end if
00459 
00460       A_grid = 0d0
00461       B_grid = 0d0
00462       b2gd_theta_0 = -pi/2d0
00463       theta_inc = (pi - 0d0) / real(Nuse, s2_dp)
00464 
00465 
00466       do itheta = 0, Nuse-1
00467 
00468          call get_results(tstop_use,R_final,RH_final,cos_bit_final,sin_bit_final)
00469          fact = sqrt(9.D0*b2gd_alpha**2+1.D0)*sqrt(1.D0+b2gd_alpha**2)* &
00470                 sqrt(1.D0-b%omega_matter-b%omega_lambda)**3.D0/b2gd_alpha**3 &
00471                 /b%omega_matter/6.D0
00472          U10_req = b%wH/fact
00473          Lambda = 3*b2gd_RH_start**2*b%omega_lambda
00474          final_dens = (3d0*RH_final**2-Lambda*R_final**2-3d0*b2gd_alpha**2)/(R_final**2)
00475 
00476         C_sin=-U10_req/(1+b2gd_ze)*2d0*( &
00477                 1/R_final*(sin_bit_final*cos(3d0/4d0*pi)-cos_bit_final*sin(3d0/4d0*pi)) &
00478                 - 3.D0/final_dens/R_final**5 &
00479                   * exp(b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)*cos(b2gd_theta_0) &
00480                   / (-1.D0-sin(b2gd_theta_0) &
00481                      + exp(2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)*sin(b2gd_theta_0) &
00482                      - exp(2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)) &
00483                   * b2gd_alpha &
00484                   * sin((b2gd_alpha*tstop_use- &
00485                           dlog(cos(pi/4.D0+b2gd_theta_0/2.D0)**2.D0 &
00486                               + exp(-2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use) &
00487                               - exp(-2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)*cos(pi/4.D0+b2gd_theta_0/2.D0)**2.D0) &
00488                          )/b2gd_alpha+3d0/4d0*pi) &
00489                + 1.D0/final_dens/R_final**5 &
00490                  *  exp(b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)*cos(b2gd_theta_0) &
00491                  / (-1.D0-sin(b2gd_theta_0) &
00492                     + exp(2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)*sin(b2gd_theta_0) &
00493                     -exp(2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)) &
00494                  * cos((-b2gd_alpha*tstop_use- &
00495                         dlog(cos(pi/4.D0+b2gd_theta_0/2.D0)**2.D0 &
00496                             + exp(-2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use) &
00497                             - exp(-2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)*cos(pi/4.D0+b2gd_theta_0/2.D0)**2.D0) &
00498                        )/b2gd_alpha+3d0/4d0*pi) &
00499                )
00500 
00501         C_cos=-U10_req/(1+b2gd_ze)*2d0*( &
00502                 1/R_final*(sin_bit_final*sin(3d0/4d0*pi)+cos_bit_final*cos(3d0/4d0*pi)) &
00503                 + 3.D0/final_dens/R_final**5 &
00504                   * exp(b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)*cos(b2gd_theta_0) &
00505                   / (-1.D0-sin(b2gd_theta_0) &
00506                      + exp(2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)*sin(b2gd_theta_0) &
00507                      - exp(2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)) &
00508                   * b2gd_alpha &
00509                   * cos((b2gd_alpha*tstop_use- &
00510                           dlog(cos(pi/4.D0+b2gd_theta_0/2.D0)**2.D0 &
00511                               + exp(-2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use) &
00512                               - exp(-2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)*cos(pi/4.D0+b2gd_theta_0/2.D0)**2.D0) &
00513                          )/b2gd_alpha+3d0/4d0*pi) &
00514                + 1.D0/final_dens/R_final**5 &
00515                  *  exp(b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)*cos(b2gd_theta_0) &
00516                  / (-1.D0-sin(b2gd_theta_0) &
00517                     + exp(2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)*sin(b2gd_theta_0) &
00518                     -exp(2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)) &
00519                  * sin((-b2gd_alpha*tstop_use- &
00520                          dlog(cos(pi/4.D0+b2gd_theta_0/2.D0)**2.D0 &
00521                             + exp(-2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use) &
00522                             - exp(-2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tstop_use)*cos(pi/4.D0+b2gd_theta_0/2.D0)**2.D0) &
00523                        )/b2gd_alpha+3d0/4d0*pi) &
00524                )
00525 
00526         A_grid(itheta) = (C_sin - C_cos) / 2d0
00527         B_grid(itheta) = (C_sin + C_cos) / 2d0
00528       
00529         b2gd_theta_0 = b2gd_theta_0 + theta_inc
00530 
00531       end do
00532 
00533 
00534       ! Compute alms.
00535       lsign = +1d0
00536       do l=1, lmax
00537          
00538          ! Invert lsign
00539          lsign=-lsign
00540 
00541          ! Compute integrals.
00542          ! Use precomputed A(theta) and B(theta).
00543             IA = bianchi2_sky_comp_IX(l, Nuse, A_grid)
00544             IB = bianchi2_sky_comp_IX(l, Nuse, B_grid)
00545 
00546          ! Compute alm for a given 1. Only m=1 is non-zero.
00547             alm(l,1) = -lsign * pi * cmplx(- handedness_sign * (IB - IA), (IA + IB))
00548 
00549       end do
00550 
00551 !      write(*,'(a)') ' Percent complete: 100.0%'
00552  
00553       ! Convert Delta_T/T alm computed to Delta_T alm.
00554       alm = BIANCHI2_CMB_T * alm
00555 
00556       ! Rotate alms if Euler angles present and ar least one angle non-zero
00557       if(present(alpha) .and. present(beta) .and. present(gamma) &
00558            .and. (abs(alpha)+abs(beta)+abs(gamma) > ZERO_TOL) ) then
00559 
00560          write(*,*) ' Rotation of the alm '
00561          allocate(dl(-lmax:lmax,-lmax:lmax),stat=fail)
00562          allocate(alm_rotate(0:lmax,0:lmax), stat=fail)
00563          if(fail/=0) then
00564             call bianchi2_error(BIANCHI2_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_FAIL, &
00565                     'bianchi_sky_rotate')
00566          endif
00567          alm_rotate = (0d0,0d0)
00568 
00569          do l = 1, lmax
00570             call s2_dl_beta_operator(dl, real(beta,s2_dp), l)        
00571             do m = 0,l
00572 
00573                !Calculation of  Dl,m,+-1
00574                Dm_p1 = exp(-icmpx*m*alpha) * dl(m, 1) * exp(-icmpx*gamma)
00575                Dm_m1 = exp(-icmpx*m*alpha) * dl(m,-1) * exp( icmpx*gamma)
00576                
00577                !Rotation of the alm
00578                alm_rotate(l,m) = - Dm_m1*conjg(alm(l,1)) + Dm_p1*alm(l,1)
00579              
00580             end do
00581          end do  
00582 
00583          ! Initialise sky object with alm_rotate.
00584          b%sky = s2_sky_init(alm_rotate, lmax, lmax, nside)    
00585 
00586          deallocate(alm_rotate)
00587          deallocate(dl)
00588 
00589       else
00590 
00591          write(*,'(a)') ' No rotation needed '
00592 
00593          ! Initialise sky object with alm.
00594          b%sky = s2_sky_init(alm, lmax, 1, nside)
00595       endif
00596 
00597       ! Set initialised status.
00598       b%init = .true.
00599 
00600       call bianchi2_sky_compute_map(b,nside)
00601 
00602       ! Free memory.
00603       deallocate(alm)
00604       deallocate(A_grid)
00605       deallocate(B_grid)
00606 
00607     end function bianchi2_sky_init_alm
00608 
00609 
00610 
00611     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00612     ! bianchi2_sky_free
00613     !
00614     !! Free all memory associated with a bianchi2 object.
00615     !!
00616     !! Variables:
00617     !!  - b: Bianchi2 object to free.
00618     !
00619     !! @author J. D. McEwen
00620     !! @version 0.1 October 2005
00621     !
00622     ! Revisions:
00623     !   October 2005 - Written by Jason McEwen
00624     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00625 
00626     subroutine bianchi2_sky_free(b)
00627 
00628       type(bianchi2_sky), intent(inout) :: b
00629 
00630       ! Check object initialised.
00631       if(.not. b%init) then
00632         call bianchi2_error(BIANCHI2_ERROR_NOT_INIT, 'bianchi2_sky_free')
00633       end if 
00634 
00635       ! Free sky.
00636       call s2_sky_free(b%sky)
00637 
00638       ! Reset attributes.
00639       b%omega_matter = 0.0d0
00640       b%omega_lambda = 0.0d0
00641       b%h = 0.0d0
00642       b%zE = 0.0d0
00643       b%wH = 0.0d0
00644       b%rhand = .true.
00645       b%init = .false.
00646 
00647     end subroutine bianchi2_sky_free
00648 
00649 
00650     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00651     ! bianchi2_sky_param_write
00652     !
00653     !! Write parameters of the Bianchi2 simulation to standard output.
00654     !!
00655     !! Variables:
00656     !!  - b: Bianchi2 object containing parameter attributes to write.
00657     !
00658     !! @author J. D. McEwen
00659     !! @version 0.1 October 2005
00660     !
00661     ! Revisions:
00662     !   October 2005 - Written by Jason McEwen
00663     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00664 
00665     subroutine bianchi2_sky_param_write(b)
00666 
00667       type(bianchi2_sky), intent(in) :: b
00668 
00669       write(*,'(a,e12.5)') ' b%omega_matter: ', b%omega_matter
00670       write(*,'(a,e12.5)') ' b%omega_lmabda: ', b%omega_lambda
00671       write(*,'(a,e23.5)') ' b%h: ', b%h
00672       write(*,'(a,e22.5)') ' b%zE: ', b%zE
00673       write(*,'(a,e22.5)') ' b%wH: ', b%wH
00674       write(*,'(a,l19)') ' b%rhand: ', b%rhand
00675 
00676     end subroutine bianchi2_sky_param_write
00677 
00678 
00679     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00680     ! bianchi2_sky_compute_map
00681     !
00682     !! Compute the map of the bianchi2 sky, assuming the alms are already
00683     !! defined.
00684     !!
00685     !! Variables:
00686     !!  - b: Bianchi2 object containing alms to compute map of.
00687     !!  - nside: Healpix nside to compute map at.
00688     !
00689     !! @author J. D. McEwen
00690     !! @version 0.1 October 2005
00691     !
00692     ! Revisions:
00693     !   October 2005 - Written by Jason McEwen
00694     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00695 
00696     subroutine bianchi2_sky_compute_map(b, nside)
00697 
00698       type(bianchi2_sky), intent(inout) :: b
00699       integer, intent(in) :: nside
00700 
00701       ! Check object initialised.
00702       if(.not. b%init) then
00703         call bianchi2_error(BIANCHI2_ERROR_NOT_INIT, &
00704           'bianchi2_sky_compute_map')
00705       end if
00706 
00707       ! Compute bianchi2 sky alms.
00708       call s2_sky_compute_map(b%sky, nside)
00709 
00710     end subroutine bianchi2_sky_compute_map
00711 
00712 
00713     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00714     ! bianchi2_sky_compute_alm
00715     !
00716     !! Compute the alm of the bianchi2 sky, assuming the map is already
00717     !! defined.
00718     !!
00719     !! Variables:
00720     !!  - b: Bianchi2 object containing sky to compute alms of.
00721     !!  - lmax: Maximum harmonic l to consider when computing alms.
00722     !!  - mmax: Maximum harmonic m to consider when computing alms.
00723     !
00724     !! @author J. D. McEwen
00725     !! @version 0.1 October 2005
00726     !
00727     ! Revisions:
00728     !   October 2005 - Written by Jason McEwen
00729     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00730 
00731     subroutine bianchi2_sky_compute_alm(b, lmax, mmax)
00732 
00733       type(bianchi2_sky), intent(inout) :: b
00734       integer, intent(in) :: lmax, mmax
00735 
00736       ! Check object initialised.
00737       if(.not. b%init) then
00738         call bianchi2_error(BIANCHI2_ERROR_NOT_INIT, &
00739           'bianchi2_sky_compute_alm')
00740       end if
00741 
00742       ! Compute bianchi2 sky alms.
00743       call s2_sky_compute_alm(b%sky, lmax, mmax)
00744 
00745     end subroutine bianchi2_sky_compute_alm
00746 
00747 
00748     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00749     ! bianchi2_sky_get_sky
00750     !
00751     !! Get sky variable from the passed bianchi2 object.
00752     !!
00753     !! Notes:
00754     !!   - Initialises a new sky as a copy of the bianchi2 sky.
00755     !!   - The returned sky is subsequently independed of the sky stored
00756     !!     herein and should be freed by the calling routine at some point.
00757     !!
00758     !! Variables:
00759     !!   - b: Bianchi2 object containing sky to get.
00760     !!   - sky: Object sky variable returned.
00761     !
00762     !! @author J. D. McEwen 
00763     !! @version 0.1 October 2005
00764     !
00765     ! Revisions:
00766     !   October 2005 - Written by Jason McEwen
00767     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00768 
00769     function bianchi2_sky_get_sky(b) result(sky)
00770 
00771       type(bianchi2_sky), intent(in) :: b
00772       type(s2_sky) :: sky
00773 
00774       ! Check object initialised.
00775       if(.not. b%init) then
00776         call s2_error(BIANCHI2_ERROR_NOT_INIT, 'bianchi2_sky_get_sky')
00777       end if 
00778 
00779       ! Make a copy for the returned sky.
00780       sky = s2_sky_init(b%sky)
00781 
00782     end function bianchi2_sky_get_sky
00783 
00784     
00785     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00786     ! bianchi2_sky_get_alm
00787     !
00788     !! Get alms contained in a bianchi2 sky object.  Alms must already be
00789     !! computed.
00790     !!
00791     !! Notes:
00792     !!   - Error occurs if alms are not already computed.
00793     !!
00794     !! Variables:
00795     !!   - b: Bianchi2 object containing sky that in turn contained the alms
00796     !!     to get.
00797     !!   - alm: Alms of simulated bianchi map extracted.
00798     !
00799     !! @author J. D. McEwen
00800     !! @version 0.1 October 2005
00801     !
00802     ! Revisions:
00803     !   October 2005 - Written by Jason McEwen
00804     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00805 
00806     subroutine bianchi2_sky_get_alm(b, alm)
00807 
00808       type(bianchi2_sky), intent(in) :: b
00809       complex(s2_spc), intent(out) :: alm(:,:)
00810 
00811       ! Check object initialised.
00812       if(.not. b%init) then
00813         call bianchi2_error(BIANCHI2_ERROR_NOT_INIT, 'bianchi2_sky_get_alm')
00814       end if 
00815 
00816       ! Get alms from sky.
00817       call s2_sky_get_alm(b%sky, alm)
00818 
00819     end subroutine bianchi2_sky_get_alm
00820 
00821 
00822     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00823     ! bianchi2_sky_apply_beam
00824     !
00825     !! Apply Gaussian beam with specified FWHM.  (FWHM must be passed in
00826     !! arcmin.)
00827     !!
00828     !! Notes:
00829     !!   - Error occurs if alms are not already computed.
00830     !!
00831     !! Variables:
00832     !!   - b: Bianchi2 object containing sky that is to be comvolved with
00833     !!     the beam.
00834     !!   - fwhm: Gaussian beam FWHM to use (specified in arcmin).
00835     !!   - lmax: Maximum harmonic l to consider.
00836     !
00837     !! @author J. D. McEwen
00838     !! @version 0.1 October 2005
00839     !
00840     ! Revisions:
00841     !   October 2005 - Written by Jason McEwen
00842     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00843 
00844     subroutine bianchi2_sky_apply_beam(b, fwhm, lmax)
00845 
00846       use s2_pl_mod
00847       use s2_vect_mod, only: s2_vect_arcmin_to_rad
00848 
00849       type(bianchi2_sky), intent(inout) :: b
00850       real(s2_sp), intent(in) :: fwhm
00851       integer, intent(in) :: lmax
00852 
00853       real(s2_sp) :: fwhm_rad
00854       type(s2_pl) :: beam
00855 
00856       ! Convert beam_fwhm to radians.
00857       fwhm_rad = s2_vect_arcmin_to_rad(fwhm)
00858 
00859       ! Create beam.
00860       beam = s2_pl_init_guassian(fwhm_rad, lmax)
00861 
00862       ! Apply beam.
00863       call s2_sky_conv(b%sky, beam)
00864 
00865       ! Free beam.
00866       call s2_pl_free(beam)
00867 
00868     end subroutine bianchi2_sky_apply_beam
00869 
00870 
00871     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00872     ! bianchi2_sky_write
00873     !
00874     !! Write the bianchi2 simulated sky to a file. 
00875     !!
00876     !! Variables:
00877     !!  - b: Bianchi2 object to save sky of.
00878     !!  - filename: Name of output file.
00879     !!  - file_type: Type of output file, either fits map or sky file 
00880     !!    (see s2_sky_mod for more details).  Integer flag that may be 
00881     !!    either S2_SKY_FILE_TYPE_MAP or S2_SKY_FILE_TYPE_SKY.
00882     !!  - [comment]: Optional comment to append to file header.
00883     !
00884     !! @author J. D. McEwen
00885     !! @version 0.1 October 2005
00886     !
00887     ! Revisions:
00888     !   October 2005 - Written by Jason McEwen
00889     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00890 
00891     subroutine bianchi2_sky_write(b, filename, file_type, comment)
00892 
00893       type(bianchi2_sky), intent(inout) :: b
00894       character(len=*), intent(in) :: filename
00895       integer, intent(in) :: file_type
00896       character(len=*), intent(in), optional :: comment
00897 
00898       ! Check object initialised.
00899       if(.not. b%init) then
00900         call bianchi2_error(BIANCHI2_ERROR_NOT_INIT, 'bianchi2_sky_write')
00901       end if 
00902 
00903       select case(file_type)
00904 
00905          case(S2_SKY_FILE_TYPE_MAP)
00906             call s2_sky_write_map_file(b%sky, filename, comment)
00907 
00908          case(S2_SKY_FILE_TYPE_SKY)
00909             call s2_sky_io_fits_write(filename, b%sky, comment)
00910 
00911          case default
00912             call s2_error(S2_ERROR_SKY_FILE_INVALID, 'bianchi2_sky_write', &
00913               comment_add='Invalid file type specifier')
00914 
00915       end select
00916 
00917     end subroutine bianchi2_sky_write
00918 
00919 
00920     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00921     ! bianchi2_sky_rotate
00922     !
00923     !! Rotate the simulated sky of the bianchi2 object.  
00924     !!
00925     !! Variables:
00926     !!  - b: Bianchi2 object containing sky to be rotated.
00927     !!  - alpha: Alpha Euler angle of the rotation.
00928     !!  - beta: Beta Euler angle of the rotation.
00929     !!  - gamma: Gamma Euler angle of the rotation.
00930     !!  - lmax: Maximum harmonic l to consider.
00931     !!  - nside: Healpix nside to compute map at.
00932     !!  - rotation_alm : put .false. in bianchi2_sim.f90 if
00933     !     one wants to perform the rotation pixel by pixel
00934     !
00935     !! @author J. D. McEwen
00936     !! @version 0.1 October 2005
00937     !
00938     ! Revisions:
00939     !   October 2005 - Written by Jason McEwen
00940     !   April   2012 - Modifications by Thibaut Josset
00941     !                  Added option to perform rotation in harmonic space.
00942     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00943 
00944     subroutine bianchi2_sky_rotate(b, alpha, beta, gamma, lmax, nside,&
00945  rotation_alm)
00946 
00947       use s2_dl_mod, only: s2_dl_beta_operator
00948 
00949       type(bianchi2_sky), intent(inout) :: b
00950       real(s2_sp), intent(in), optional :: alpha, beta, gamma
00951 
00952       logical, intent(in) :: rotation_alm
00953       integer, intent(in) :: lmax, nside
00954       integer :: l, m
00955       integer :: fail=10
00956       complex(s2_spc), allocatable :: alm(:,:)
00957       complex(s2_spc), allocatable :: alm_rotate(:,:)
00958       real(s2_dp), pointer :: dl(:,:) => null()
00959       complex(s2_dpc) :: Dm_p1, Dm_m1
00960       real(s2_sp), parameter :: ZERO_TOL = 1d-4
00961       complex(s2_dpc) :: icmpx
00962       !set icmpx=sqrt(-1)
00963       icmpx = cmplx(0d0,1d0)
00964 
00965       ! Check object initialised.
00966       if(.not. b%init) then
00967         call bianchi2_error(BIANCHI2_ERROR_NOT_INIT, 'bianchi2_sky_rotate')
00968       end if
00969       
00970 
00971       ! Rotate if Euler angles present and at least one angle non-zero
00972       if(present(alpha) .and. present(beta) .and. present(gamma) &
00973            .and. (abs(alpha)+abs(beta)+abs(gamma) > ZERO_TOL) ) then
00974          
00975          !Choose between rotation pixel by pixel or rotation of the alm
00976          if (rotation_alm == .false.) then
00977 
00978             write(*,'(a)') ' Rotation pixel by pixel with s2_sky_rotate '
00979             call s2_sky_rotate(b%sky, alpha, beta, gamma)
00980 
00981          else
00982 
00983             write(*,'(a)') ' Rotation of the alm '
00984             allocate(dl(-lmax:lmax,-lmax:lmax),stat=fail)
00985             allocate(alm(0:lmax,0:1), stat=fail)
00986             allocate(alm_rotate(0:lmax,0:lmax), stat=fail)
00987             if(fail/=0) then
00988                call bianchi2_error(BIANCHI2_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_FAIL, &
00989                     'bianchi_sky_rotate')
00990             endif
00991             alm_rotate = 0e0
00992 
00993             !get alm
00994             call bianchi2_sky_compute_alm(b,lmax,1)
00995             call bianchi2_sky_get_alm(b, alm)
00996 
00997             ! perform rotation in harmonic space,&
00998             ! noting Bianchi alms only non zero for m=+-1)
00999             do l = 1,lmax
01000 
01001                call s2_dl_beta_operator(dl, real(beta,s2_dp), l)
01002             
01003                do m = 0,l
01004 
01005 
01006                   !Calculation of  Dl,m,+-1
01007                   Dm_p1 = exp(-icmpx*m*alpha) * dl(m, 1) * exp(-icmpx*gamma)
01008                   Dm_m1 = exp(-icmpx*m*alpha) * dl(m,-1) * exp( icmpx*gamma)
01009 
01010                   !Rotation of the alm
01011                   alm_rotate(l,m) = - Dm_m1*conjg(alm(l,1)) + Dm_p1*alm(l,1)
01012              
01013                end do
01014 
01015             end do
01016            
01017             !Make free b%sky
01018             call s2_sky_free(b%sky)
01019 
01020             ! Compute sky object with rotated alms
01021             b%sky = s2_sky_init(alm_rotate, lmax, lmax, nside)
01022            
01023             call bianchi2_sky_compute_map(b,nside)
01024 
01025             ! Dellocate memory used for rotating alms
01026             deallocate(alm_rotate)
01027             deallocate(alm)
01028             deallocate(dl)
01029 
01030          end if
01031 
01032        else
01033           write(*,'(a)') ' No rotation needed '
01034        endif
01035 
01036     end subroutine bianchi2_sky_rotate
01037 
01038 
01039     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01040     ! Routines to compute Bianchi induced fluctuations
01041     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01042 
01043     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01044     ! get_results
01045     !
01046     !! This returns the values found at the end of the integral
01047     !
01048     !! @author A. N. Lasenby
01049     !! @version 08/10/05
01050     !
01051     ! Revisions:
01052     !   October 2005 - Incorporated into library by JDM
01053     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01054 
01055     subroutine get_results(tstop_use, R_final, RH_final, &
01056          cos_bit_final, sin_bit_final)
01057 
01058       use s2_types_mod
01059       use bianchi2_globaldata_mod
01060 
01061       implicit none
01062 
01063       real(s2_dp), intent(in) :: tstop_use
01064       real(s2_dp), intent(out) :: R_final,RH_final,cos_bit_final,sin_bit_final
01065 
01066       integer, parameter :: neq = 4
01067 
01068       real(s2_dp) :: vals(b2gd_nvars)
01069       real(s2_dp) :: warr(21*neq+28)
01070       real(s2_dp) :: tstart,tol
01071       real(s2_dp) :: tmin,tmax,t,tend    
01072       real(s2_dp) :: R,RH
01073 #ifdef NAGI8
01074       integer(kind=8) :: neqn,irelab,ifail
01075 #else
01076       integer :: neqn,irelab,ifail
01077 #endif
01078 
01079       character(len=1) :: relabs
01080       external d02cjw
01081 
01082       b2gd_tstop=tstop_use
01083       tstart=0
01084         
01085       b2gd_nt=3
01086 
01087       b2gd_deltat=(b2gd_tstop-tstart)/(b2gd_nt-1)
01088 
01089       tmin=tstart
01090       tmax=b2gd_tstop
01091 
01092       tol=1d-12
01093 
01094       t=tstart
01095 
01096       ! Next bit sets up initial value for R
01097 
01098       vals(1)=1
01099 
01100       ! Next bit sets up initial value for RH
01101 
01102       vals(2)=b2gd_RH_start
01103 
01104       vals(3)=0d0
01105       vals(4)=0d0
01106 
01107       t=tstart
01108       tend=b2gd_tstop
01109       neqn=neq
01110       irelab=0
01111       ifail=1
01112       b2gd_it=b2gd_nt-2
01113       relabs='D'
01114 
01115       call d02cjf(t,tend,neqn,vals,fcn,tol,relabs,out,d02cjw,warr,ifail)
01116 
01117       ! Check success.
01118       if((ifail/=0).and.(ifail/=1)) then
01119         call bianchi2_error(BIANCHI2_ERROR_SKY_NUM_FAIL, 'get_results', &
01120           comment_add='NAG routine d02cjf failed')
01121       end if
01122       
01123       do b2gd_it=1,b2gd_nt
01124          b2gd_treal(b2gd_it)=b2gd_tarr(b2gd_it)
01125          R=b2gd_xarr(1,b2gd_it)
01126          RH=b2gd_xarr(2,b2gd_it)
01127          t=b2gd_tarr(b2gd_it)
01128          b2gd_xreal(b2gd_it)=R
01129       end do
01130 
01131       R_final=b2gd_xarr(1,b2gd_nt)
01132       RH_final=b2gd_xarr(2,b2gd_nt)     
01133       cos_bit_final=b2gd_xarr(3,b2gd_nt)        
01134       sin_bit_final=b2gd_xarr(4,b2gd_nt)
01135 
01136     end subroutine get_results
01137 
01138 
01139     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01140     ! fcn
01141     !
01142     !! @author A. N. Lasenby
01143     !! @version 08/10/05
01144     !
01145     ! Revisions:
01146     !   October 2005 - Incorporated into library by JDM
01147     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01148 
01149     subroutine fcn(t,vars,ff)
01150 
01151       use s2_types_mod
01152       use bianchi2_globaldata_mod
01153 
01154       implicit none
01155       integer, parameter :: neq = 4
01156       integer, parameter :: nvars = 4
01157 
01158       real(s2_dp), intent(in) :: t
01159       real(s2_dp), intent(in) :: vars(nvars)
01160       real(s2_dp), intent(out) :: ff(nvars)
01161 
01162       real(s2_dp) ::tau
01163       real(s2_dp) :: R,RH,Lambda
01164       real(s2_dp) :: arg,fact
01165 
01166       R=vars(1)
01167       RH=vars(2)
01168       tau=t
01169 
01170       Lambda=3*b2gd_RH_start**2*b2gd_Omega_Lambda
01171 
01172       ff(1)=R*RH
01173 
01174       ff(2)=-RH**2.D0/2.D0+Lambda*R**2.D0/2.D0+b2gd_alpha**2/2.D0
01175 
01176       arg=(b2gd_alpha*tau+dlog(cos(0.3141592653589793D1/4.D0+ &
01177            b2gd_theta_0/2.D0)**2.D0+exp(-2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tau)-&
01178            exp(-2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tau)*cos(0.3141592653589793D1/4.D0+ &
01179            b2gd_theta_0/2.D0)**2.D0))/b2gd_alpha
01180 
01181       fact=-2.D0/R**2*exp(b2gd_alpha*tau)*cos(b2gd_theta_0)/(-1.D0-sin(b2gd_theta_0)+ &
01182            exp(2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tau)*sin(b2gd_theta_0)-exp(2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tau))**2.D0* &
01183            (1.D0+sin(b2gd_theta_0)+exp(2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tau)*sin(b2gd_theta_0)- &
01184            exp(2.D0*b2gd_alpha*tau))
01185 
01186       ff(3)=fact*cos(arg)
01187       
01188       ff(4)=fact*sin(arg)
01189 
01190     end subroutine fcn
01191 
01192 
01193     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01194     ! out
01195     !
01196     !! @author A. N. Lasenby
01197     !! @version 08/10/05
01198     !
01199     ! Revisions:
01200     !   October 2005 - Incorporated into library by JDM
01201     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01202 
01203     subroutine out(t,vals)
01204 
01205       use s2_types_mod
01206       use bianchi2_globaldata_mod
01207 
01208       implicit none
01209 
01210       real(s2_dp), intent(inout) :: t
01211       real(s2_dp), intent(in) :: vals(b2gd_nvars)
01212 
01213       real(s2_dp) :: deriv(b2gd_nvars)
01214       integer :: iel, ival
01215 
01216       iel=b2gd_nt-(b2gd_it+1)
01217       b2gd_tarr(iel)=t
01218       do ival=1,b2gd_nvars
01219          b2gd_xarr(ival,iel)=vals(ival)
01220       end do
01221       
01222       call fcn(t,vals,deriv)
01223 
01224       t=b2gd_tstop-b2gd_it*b2gd_deltat
01225       b2gd_it=b2gd_it-1
01226 
01227     end subroutine out
01228

01230     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01231     ! get_tau
01232     !
01233     !! @author A. N. Lasenby
01234     !! @version 08/10/05
01235     !
01236     ! Revisions:
01237     !   October 2005 - Incorporated into library by JDM
01238     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01239 
01240     subroutine get_tau(tau_needed)
01241 
01242       use s2_types_mod
01243       use bianchi2_globaldata_mod
01244 
01245       implicit none
01246 
01247       real(s2_dp), intent(out) :: tau_needed
01248 
01249       real(s2_dp) :: aa, ABSERR, bb, EPSABS, EPSREL, RESULT_VAL
01250 
01251 #ifdef NAGI8
01252       integer(kind=8) :: IFAIL
01253       integer(kind=8), parameter :: LIWORK = 10000
01254       integer(kind=8), parameter :: LWORK = 10000
01255       integer(kind=8) :: IWORK(LIWORK)
01256 #else
01257       integer :: IFAIL
01258       integer, parameter :: LIWORK = 10000
01259       integer, parameter :: LWORK = 10000
01260       integer :: IWORK(LIWORK)
01261 #endif
01262 
01263       real(s2_dp) :: WORK(LWORK)
01264 
01265       ifail=0
01266       epsabs=1d-6
01267       epsrel=1d-8
01268 
01269       aa=1d0/sqrt(1+b2gd_ze)
01270       bb=1d0
01271       call d01ajf(F1r,aa,bb,EPSABS,EPSREL,RESULT_VAL,ABSERR,WORK,LWORK,&
01272         IWORK,LIWORK,IFAIL)
01273         
01274       tau_needed=result_val
01275 
01276     end subroutine get_tau
01277 
01278 
01279     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01280     ! F1r
01281     !
01282     !! @author A. N. Lasenby
01283     !! @version 08/10/05
01284     !
01285     ! Revisions:
01286     !   October 2005 - Incorporated into library by JDM
01287     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01288 
01289     function F1r(a)
01290 
01291       use s2_types_mod
01292       use bianchi2_globaldata_mod
01293 
01294       implicit none
01295 
01296       real(s2_dp) :: F1r
01297       real(s2_dp), intent(in) :: a
01298 
01299       real(s2_dp) :: t0
01300 
01301       t0 = -b2gd_alpha**2*(b2gd_Omega_Lambda*a**6-a**2*b2gd_Omega_matter-a**2* &
01302            b2gd_Omega_Lambda+a**2+b2gd_Omega_matter)/(b2gd_Omega_matter+b2gd_Omega_Lambda-1)
01303 
01304       F1r=2d0/sqrt(t0)
01305 
01306     end function F1r
01307

01313 
01314     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01315     ! Bianchi integrals
01316     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01317  
01318     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01319     ! bianchi2_sky_comp_IX
01320     !
01321     !! Compute IA and IB integrals required in Bianchi2 simulation.
01322     !!
01323     !! Variables:
01324     !!   - l: Harmonic l to compute IA_l or IB_l for.
01325     !!   - Nuse : Number of terms in use in the integration.
01326     !!   - X_grid : Contains the values A_grid(itheta) or B_grid(itheta).
01327     !
01328     !! @author T. Josset
01329     !! @version 0.1 April 2012
01330     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------  
01331 
01332     function bianchi2_sky_comp_IX(l, Nuse, X_grid) result(IX)
01333 
01334       integer, intent(in) :: l, Nuse
01335       real(s2_dp), intent(in) :: X_grid(0:) ! X = A or B
01336       real(s2_dp) :: integrand, IX
01337 
01338       integer :: itheta
01339       real(s2_dp) :: dtheta, theta
01340 
01341 
01342       IX = 0d0
01343       theta = 0d0
01344       dtheta = (pi - 0d0) / Real(Nuse, s2_dp)
01345       
01346       do itheta = 0, Nuse-1
01347          
01348          integrand = sin(theta) * X_grid(itheta) * plgndr(l,1,cos(theta))
01349          IX = IX + integrand*dtheta
01350          theta = theta + dtheta
01351          
01352       end do
01353 
01354       IX = IX * sqrt( (2d0*l+1d0) / real(4d0*pi*l*(l+1d0), s2_dp) ) 
01355 
01356       return
01357     end function bianchi2_sky_comp_IX
01358  
01359 
01360     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01361     ! Special function routines
01362     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01363 
01364     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01365     ! plgndr
01366     !
01367     !! Computes the associated Legendre function for l and m.
01368     !!  Adapted from numerical recipes 
01369     !!
01370     !! Notes:
01371     !!   - Numerical recipies comment:
01372     !!     Computes the associated Legendre polynomial P_m^l(x).
01373     !!
01374     !! Variables:
01375     !!   - l: Legendre function l parameter.
01376     !!   - m: Legendre function m parameter.
01377     !!   - x: Point to evaluate specified Legendre funtion at.
01378     !
01379     !! @author J. D. McEwen
01380     !! @version 0.1 June 2005
01381     !
01382     ! Revisions:
01383     !   June 2005 - Written by Jason McEwen
01384     !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01385 
01386     function plgndr(l,m,x)
01387 
01388       integer :: l, m
01389       real(s2_dp) :: plgndr, x
01390 
01391       integer :: i, ll
01392       real(s2_dp) ::  fact, pll, pmm, pmmp1, somx2
01393 
01394       if(m<0 .or. m>l .or. abs(x)>1d0) stop 'bad arguments in plgndr'
01395 
01396       pmm=1.                     ! Compute Pmm.
01397       if(m.gt.0) then
01398          somx2=sqrt((1.-x)*(1.+x))
01399          fact=1.
01400          do i=1,m
01401             pmm=-pmm*fact*somx2
01402             fact=fact+2.
01403          enddo
01404       endif
01405       if(l.eq.m) then
01406          plgndr=pmm
01407       else
01408          pmmp1=x*(2*m+1)*pmm      ! Compute Pm m+1.
01409          if(l.eq.m+1) then
01410             plgndr=pmmp1
01411          else                    ! Compute Pm  l , l > m+ 1.
01412             do ll=m+2,l
01413                pll=(x*(2*ll-1)*pmmp1-(ll+m-1)*pmm)/(ll-m)
01414                pmm=pmmp1
01415                pmmp1=pll
01416             enddo
01417             plgndr=pll
01418          endif
01419       endif
01420       return
01421     end function plgndr
01422 
01423 
01424 end module bianchi2_sky_mod
